label: Or. 12.885, f001

metadata.label: Condition
metadata.value: Quite good; parts of the papyrus strips are missing at the top-right corner.

metadata.label: Cutting lines
metadata.value:
Left, top and bottom sides.
The right side has been torn off causing a loss of text in lines 1-10.

metadata.label: Personal names
metadata.value: Abū Bakr; Muḥammad; Muhammad b. Abī Sufyān

metadata.label: Content description
metadata.value: Commercial letter which begins with some unusual formulae in the opening greetings (l. 2) which are followed by the common remark that the sender has received a letter from the addressee (l. 3). The sender,informs the addressee, Abū Bakr, about some products which he has bought and intends to bring to Cairo (l. 4). The sender mentions other commercial transactions involving precious stones either asking the addressee to buy him ten or informing the latter that he himself has bought ten stones (l. 5). He informs the addressee also of a delivery of stones (l. 9). The sender ends his letter by conveying greetings to the addressee's business relations and by sending greetings from the partners who are with the sender, and by asking him for a letter containing news about his health and needs (l. 11).

metadata.label: Diacritical dots
metadata.value: No, except for diacritics on one word.
